facts: Most short visits require a B-1/B-2 (visitor) visa unless you are visa-exempt via Visa Waiver Program (country-dependent).
Applicants frequently must show intent to return to home country, proof of funds, and purpose of visit.
Biometrics (fingerprints/photo) and an in-person interview may be required for many nonimmigrant visas.
Immigrant (green card) paths are numerous (family-sponsored, employment-based); each has category-specific requirements and priority processing rules.
visa_free_policy: Visa Waiver Program allows eligible nationalities short stays (usually up to 90 days) without a visa; ESTA required.
fees: Varies by category; many nonimmigrant visas have MRV fee around $185 (subject to change).
processing_time: From a few days to several months depending on category and embassy workload.
notes: Always confirm category-specific rules on USCIS/State Dept sites.
